list_definition.definition: to trade by giving (one thing) in exchange (for another)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The bandits used to barter gold for guns.

list_definition.mean_english: sự trao đổi hàng lấy hàng

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Some tribes used seashells as barter.

list_ex_of_english: Writing thus becomes a kind of good work that, through a barter system, produces good trade which indirectly facilitates the writer's craft.
No business man has any incentive to produce; the workman has nothing to go for and, therefore, he barters and goes out foraging in the countryside.
The pernicious doctrine grows up that land is a thing that can be bartered as a chattel, instead of it belonging to the community as a whole.
Tracts are often shuffled through swaps, barters and exchange, or purchase.
Most of what was consumed on these farms was homemade or bartered for.
At the same time, exchange relationships permitted each group to complement its diet, through the barter of meat and milk for millet and sorghum.
If trade frictions are moderate, bills circulate as a general medium of exchange, and the level of specialization is higher relative to barter.
We have neither sold nor bartered these possessions: we gave them away.
